snippet: The president of the European Commission urged Europeans to remember ancestors who sought refuge from religious persecution and war and famine.
abstract: European Union Pres Jean-Claude Juncker proposes distributing 160,000 migrants evenly throughout bloc, idea that has faced resistance among some member states; presents situation as humanitarian issue and test of Europe's unity, while acknowledging plan is inadequate to address crisis that has sent half a million people fleeing war-torn countries in 2015 alone.

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin, and Dan Bilefsky from London.

lead_paragraph: The president of the European Commission urged Europeans to remember ancestors who sought refuge from religious persecution and war and famine.

headline.main: E.U. Nations Urged to Accept 160,000 Migrants
headline.print_headline: E.U. Nations Urged to Accept 160,000 Migrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
